commit message: Initial commit (version 1.0rc1).
Add Eclipse project files

Some minor fixes before public release of 1.0rc1:
* Fix Manifest for aTrackDog.
* Fix a bug in the status icon code.
Add translatable='false' to values in constants.xml
New icons, a bit closer to Android's icon design guidelines.
Bump version to 1.0rc2.

Don't start the service if no parcels are in the database. Also stop and start the service when the database becomes (un)empty.
(Some minor code cleanup is also included.)
Make empty mass updates update tell its RefreshContext that it ended directly, don't just return.
Fix service starting on boot even when database is empty.
Bump version number to 1.0rc3
Version bump to 1.0, I think it's release time! :)

Fix aTrackDog metadata in Manifest.
Minor bump of versionCode due to application already being released on Market.
Bump version to 1.1beta and remove aTrackDog 'dlUrl'.

Major refactor of the way the refresh dialog works. Now also applies to ParcelIdDialog.
Not extensively tested, but seems to work fine.
Also change the input hack for ParcelIdDialog a bit to probably make it more compatible.
Also remember cursor position in ParcelIdDialog.

Remember cursor position in ParcelIdDialog.
Also remove an obsolete file forgotten in the last commit.
Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:firetech/PactrackDroid
Add possibility to deactivate background update for individual parcels. If no parcels have background updates activated, the service will not be running.
Add missing GPL comments to some files.
Add support for scanning barcodes (using Barcode Scanner) for entering parcel IDs.
Release time for 1.1 :)
Use another Exception for NOT_FOUND errors, since IndexOutOfBounds can be thrown during 'normal' behavior.
Bump version to 1.2.
Add support for error events.

Minor Manifest fixes, to be released quite soon:
* Support all available screen sizes (app seems to run fine in QVGA on the emulator, at least)
* Allow installation on SD card (android 2.2 feature)
New launcher icons for Android 2.0+, created by coolof on Swedroid forums.

Bump version number and disable SD card installation.

SD card installation was disabled due to the app's miniscule size and because it
has a background service, which isn't behaving correctly when installed on SD.
Update copyright year (2009 -> 2011).
Whitespace fix.
Update ParcelService to use Android 2.0+ API better.

Fix bug which caused read server data would be truncated.

Server data would sometimes be truncated due to ParcelXMLParcer.characters()
being called multiple times with only parts of the data. This was mistakenly
thought to be server errors (sorry!).

Add Sony Ericsson LiveViewâ„¢ support.

Not extensively tested for long-term behaviour, but seems to work well in short-term.
Also included are some minor refactorings.
Rename main window class from PactrackDroid to MainWindow.
Forgot to update the version number here...

Some LiveView fixes.

Remove special LiveView icon and fix some strings.
Bump version number.

Some fixes for parcel updates.

* Set full Parcel ID when known, to avoid multiple hits in updates (and prepare
for possibly handling multiple parcel hits in the future).
* When there is only one new event, show the event in the notification, instead
of just '1 new event'.
Add HDPI version of refresh icon.

Add LiveView permission to manifest.

This is optional, but tells the user that the LiveView is accessed.

Do an initial modernizing

- Remove usage of outdated drawables
- Set the theme as Holo
- Update manifest
- Swap button order
Fix some more Alert dialog drawable code to match Holo

More Fixes

- Update refresh drawable for actionbar
- Add Refresh to actionbar
- Set correct theme for ParcelView activity
Update version and fix drawable mistake

Remove dialog drawable, set correct theme for Settings and add readme

The generic dialogs no longer have icons in 3.x.

Update version and copyright

Also add missing drawable
Update About message

Should now gracefully downgrade to HoloLight on API level < 14

The Holo Light with Dark Actionbar theme requires API level 14+

Add actionbar back arrow to ParcelView
Add whitespace to About message
Add back carot to ConfigView
Update target to API level 18 (Android 4.3)
Update almost all drawables and add xxhdpi assets
Make button layout xml more readable
Make dialog buttons look holo-like
Fix language referring to Barcode Scanner and fix warnings

Modernize Add Parcel dialog and reduce clutter
- Use holo dialog buttons

Small change that supposedly improves layout performance slightly
Fix event view padding and use Holo Light for API level 14 and later
Merge remote-tracking branch 'blunden/master'

Remove LiveView support.

I have a feeling it isn't of much use...

New icon, based on a vectorization of the previous one.

Adds xhdpi and xxhdpi icons.
Update .gitingore
Fix warnings, target Android 4.4.
New notification icon more closely matching the Android 3.0+ style.
Update Copyrights, give blunden credit EVERYWHERE. :)
Bump version to 1.5

Add support for setting a custom name/description on parcels.

This name replaces the parcel id in lists, titles and notifications, making it easier to track multiple shipments.

Add a FIXME to ParcelXMLParser.

The XML API we use seems to only manage MyPack(?). Some parcels can be tracked on www.posten.se but not through the XML API, even though the data that we do get through the XML API is identical to the data on www.posten.se...

Update README.

Remove Installation and Requirements, the app will get back on Play Store.

Update menus.

* Rename the edit action, since it edits more than the ID now.
* Remove unnecessary parcel view submenu for automatic updates.
* Only enable the automatic updates (per parcel) item if the automatic updates are enabled.
Update Android Support Library v4.
Since we're targeting newer Androids only, don't suppress deprecation warnings.
Order parcels by what's displayed, not the parcel ID.
Add note about why a parcel may not be found.
Change default value of automatic update interval from off to 1 hour.
Show 'Update all' in the action bar of the main activity.

Update the notification code.

Now notifications are expandable with all new events, if supported.

Convert ConfigView to use PreferenceFragment.

Quite useless for a small app like this, but avoids the deprecation notices and I wanted to learn a bit about fragments. ;)

Minor optimization in MainWindow, fix some deprecation warnings.

Reuse the SimpleCursorAdapter in MainWindow instead of recreating it on refresh.
Also fixes an issue where parcels deleted from ParcelView wouldn't be removed from the list immediately.

Use LoaderManager for all database reading in frontend.

This removes all deprecation warnings and (somewhat) prepares the code for a fragment based UI.
Remove add button in MainWindow, replace with action on action bar.
Change ParcelIdDialog title when editing a parcel.
Bump version number.

Fix data loading when rotating the screen.

See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12507617/android-loader-not-triggering-callbacks-on-screen-rotate#comment16867142_12507617
Some minor work on the action bar.

Slight redesign. Use Holo.Light instead of Holo.Light.DarkActionBar.

Includes a new custom icon for the add parcel action.
Also switches to use local icons instead of android.R.drawables.
Give status icons full opacity when automatic updates are globally disabled.
Fetch version name from manifest instead of duplicating it as R.string.version_name.
Remove unnecessary style definition.

Preferences overhaul.

* Better use of fragments, dividing the preferences into two separate fragments.
* New method for disabling automatic updates (compatible with the old method).
* Collect the default values for all preferences in one place (constants.xml).
* Some minor enhancements to preference strings.
Nicer isValidFragment() implementation.

Major modernization of ParcelIdDialog.

Now based on DialogFragment instead, removing the need for
BarcodeListeningListActivity and, partly, DialogAwareListActivity (RefreshDialog
still uses it, but not for long).

For the user, there is no noticeable change, but removal of
DialogAwareListActivity is somwehat needed for a Fragment based tablet UI.
Fix refresh of individual parcels.

Modernize the RefreshDialog code as well.

This also removes the (very non-Android-ish) DialogAwareListActivity, and uses
Android's built in support for similar handling (in DialogFragment).

However, to simplify some stuff, it's (temporarily, I hope) replaced with a
RefreshContextListActivity (only to deduplicate some bits of code, that should
be possible to handle in other ways after a Fragment transition of the UI.

Fix initial value of progress dialog after rotating screen.

Also fix some comments.

Major UI revamp. Now Fragment based with Tablet support.

Most of the UI code is now simpler with less weird pointers floating around. :)
This should work fully, but may contain bugs or minor weirdness.
Update copyright.

Google-inspired visual update

- Action bar branded with PostNord brand accent color
- White action bar app icon similar to recent Google apps
- New Project Moonshine-inspired launcher icon
- Bumped required API level to 14 (look into using Support Library)
Add the forgotten xhdpi, hdpi and mdpi launcher icons

Holo Light is not available on anything below API level 16

- It was mistakenly used on API level 14 here

Remove special handling of error events.

The soon-to-be-used new API does not differentiate between events and errorevents.

Add Android Wear notification background.

Just a large, non-transparent, version of the icon for now.
Also updates android-support-v4.jar to get support for this.

Reset parcel error status on update.

Fixes #3.
Fix status icon not updating auto status (opacity) properly in single pane layout.
Show the name of the parcel being refreshed.

Switch to a better API from PostNord.

This API is more officially supported, and can find parcels the old one couldn't.
It requires a 'consumer ID', which due to their rules must be kept secret, so it's not included in the open source code. Requesting a consumer ID for a fork is, however, very simple (there's a link in ParcelJsonParser.java).

The new API has so far not been tested thoroughly, but the current code works without issues for my saved collection of mixed parcel ID:s. Of course, most of those parces have already been delivered...

This update will wipe the events table in the database, since the two API:s differ a lot in representation there (would result i duplicate events otherwise).

Fix for duplicated parcels in back stack.

Editing the viewed parcel (in single pane/phone view) would add the parcel above itself on the back stack.
Bump version number and targetSDK.
Add some error handling for json data that I _guess_ might be missing in some cases.
Bump blunden's copyright. He did work this year as well.
Fix some more possibly missing data. This fixes at least one 'varubrev'.
Add note about consumer ID to README.md, and make sure the assets directory exists.

Move consumer ID from an asset file to an XML resource file.

Material Design seems to conflict with the assets directory.
Give blunden more deserved credits in the README. :)
Use the android-support-v4.jar provided by android-support-v7-appcompat

Make the actionbar buttons work

Cleanup and adjust margins/padding for the parcel id dialog

Only applies to API level 21 since older levels don't use material
dialogs yet. The buttons still need adjustments but this is fine for
now.
Remove old styled holo theme assets
Ignore fatal missing translations error caused by support library
Remove unnecessary dependency.

Add (limited) support for shipments that are split into multiple parcels.

The ID of an individual parcel must be the ID entered into the app, and the app
will then track that parcel. The data received from the API contains info about
all the items, which made the app confused before.
